intro: Aquilaria yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan agarwood, is a rare and valuable tree native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its aromatic heartwood, which is highly prized in traditional medicine and incense production. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations between 1,200 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green. The species is also known for its unique ability to produce a resinous substance under certain environmental stress conditions.
